annotation: The apparition of the land surveyors in the preceding story leads into this short story of the apparition of a death omen. Carriages arriving late at night, or funeral processions that strangely disappear are common omens for an impending death (DS II H 428, H 430).
danish_manuscript:
Der var et Sted i Nielstrup som de sad aller-
bedst om Aftenen da hørte de noget der ras-
lede og da de saa ud var det ligesom en Lig-
skare der trak ud af deres Gaard, og s. inden
et halvt Aar døde en gl. Kone de havde. det
var min Bedstemoders Svigermoder.
english_manuscript: While they were sitting one evening some place in Nielstrup, they heard something clattering, and when they looked out, it looked as if a funeral procession was leaving their farm, and then within a half year, an old woman they had there died. That was my grandmother's mother-in-law.
danish_publication: Som de sad allerbedst om aftenen et sted i Nielstrup, hørte de noget, der raslede, og da de så ud, var det, ligesom der trak en ligskare ud af deres gård, og så inden et halvt år døde en gammel kone, de havde, det var netop min bedstemoders svigermoder.
english_publication: While they were sitting one evening some place in Nielstrup, they heard something clattering, and when they looked out, it looked as if a funeral procession was leaving their farm, and then within a half year, an old woman that lived with them there died, that was my grandmother’s mother-in-law.
